body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY! 

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug


**What happened**:

After I upgraded the apiserver in a cluster from v1.8.4 to v1.9.0-beta.0, the apiserver started crashlooping.

**What you expected to happen**:

No crashloop :)

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
use kubeadm from master
```
kubeadm init
// v1.8.4
kubeadm upgrade apply v1.9.0-beta.0 -f
```

**Anything else we need to know?**:

relevant apiserver log

```
E1122 20:33:31.901146       1 storage_rbac.go:186] unable to prime aggregated clusterroles: resourceVersion should not be set on objects to be created
E1122 20:33:32.902154       1 status.go:62] apiserver received an error that is not an metav1.Status: resourceVersion should not be set on objects to be created
```

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
- Install tools:
- Others:

This should probably be prioritized for v1.9

@kubernetes/sig-api-machinery-pr-reviews

title: API Server crashlooping after upgrade from v1.8.4 to v1.9.0-beta.0
